thread.title: US wrestlers get warm welcome in Iran after visa-immigration backlash nearly canceled their trip - For The Win
thread.title_full: US wrestlers get warm welcome in Iran after visa-immigration backlash nearly canceled their trip - For The Win

title: US wrestlers get warm welcome in Iran after visa-immigration backlash nearly canceled their trip - For The Win
text:
U.S. wrestlers get warm welcome in Iran after visa-immigration backlash nearly canceled their trip U.S. wrestlers get warm welcome in Iran after visa-immigration backlash nearly canceled their trip U.S. wrestlers get warm welcome in Iran after visa-immigration backlash nearly canceled their trip By Maggie Hendricks February 13, 2017 3:04 pm 328 shares email By: Maggie Hendricks | February 13, 2017 3:04 pm 
American wrestlers traveled to Kershmanshah, Iran, for the freestyle World Cup later this month, and were given a warm reception by fans and media. Two-time Olympian Jordan Burroughs — who beat Iranian Sadegh Goudarzi for gold in 2012 — shared the moment on his Instagram. A post shared by Jordan Burroughs (@alliseeisgold) on Feb 13, 2017 at 8:33am PST 
A large crowd gathered around him. American wrestler @alliseeisgold arriving for the 2017 World Cup in #Kermanshah2017 ! (Credit: @IamRichPerry86k ) pic.twitter.com/WxsrCdEzwe 
— World Wrestling (@wrestling) February 13, 2017 
Despite a tense history between the United States and Iran, the two countries’ wrestling teams have often faced off. Their relationship on the wrestling mat was put in jeopardy after Donald Trump included Iran among banned countries in in an executive order regarding immigration and refugees. Iran, in turn, banned Americans from Iran and the event was put into jeopardy. After a judge stopped Trump’s executive order, Iran allowed the U.S. contingent to travel to Kershmanshah to compete. More Olympics!
